DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis is that gut hormones are released after oral but not intravenous amino acids which result in stimulation of insulin secretion.
DOC.brief_title: Gut Hormones After Oral Versus Intravenous Amino Acids
DOC.detailed_description: Amino acid mixture is given orally or intravenously to match total concentrations of amino acids in healthy subjects. Samples are taken regularly for 300 min after administrations. Plasma levels of the gut hormones glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) and glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1)and determined and related to plasma levels of insulin and glucagon.
DOC.criteria: Healthy subjects Diabetes Liver disease Kidney disease Thyroid disease
